DOCNAME: CASE OF LASZLO NEMETH v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In the context of a real estate dispute , on CARDINAL DATE the applicant brought an action claiming partial ownership of a house .
CARDINAL . After having held several hearings and obtained the opinions of CARDINAL experts , on CARDINAL DATE the applicant was granted CARDINAL of the property in question .
CARDINAL . NORP On appeal , on DATE the ORG - ORG quashed this decision .

CARDINAL . In the resumed proceedings , ORG held several hearings and obtained the opinion of an expert . On DATE it gave judgment , granting the applicant partial ownership . Simultaneously , it dissolved the common ownership thus created , gave the part allocated to the applicant to the respondent , and ordered the latter to compensate the former .
CARDINAL . On appeal , on DATE ORG amended this decision and gave a final judgment .
CARDINAL . The applicant filed a petition for review with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the petition in preliminary proceedings . In a reasoned decision , it held that the applicant ’s petition was inadmissible because it did not disclose a breach of the relevant law , in particular the rules concerning the termination of common ownership . ORG order was served on him on DATE .
